pr_title: Store API tokens encrypted in MongoDB

timeline.message: Move access token related implementation classes to separate package

WIP: encrypt tokens when storing in DB, decrypt when reading

The encryption is not deterministic yet. But it has to be, to get this
working. We may need to switch to a different encryption algorithm.
Merge branch 'master' into api-token-encryption

Revert encrypt/decrypt methods with byte[] salt

We won't need it anymore.

Use AES SIV to encrypt the access tokens

This ensures deterministic cipher text values so we can use the value to
lookup the tokes in the database.

We need this because our API token implementation only knows about the
token and has no user account or token name information. Changing this
to get a more secure implementation would be a breaking API change.

Support access token deletion by using the token ID

Previously the token deletion endpoint only supported using the plain
text token in the URL. This is an issue because URLs will be
logged in HTTP server and proxy logs.

The UI is now using the token ID for deletion.

Add missing encrypt() call in token service

The create() method doesn't use save() but saveWithoutValidation().

Save a "token_type" field for each access token

This will help with migrating access tokens to a new encryption scheme.
Add migration to encrypt existing API access tokens
Add note about encrypted API access tokens to UPGRADING
Adjust TokenList.test.jsx after changes
Only use 16 bytes for the SIV macKey
Add some comments
